intro: Psychotria desseinii subsp. minor, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing small, dark seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
